newsitem.title: MAURITIUS: Bank SBM stocks push Mauritius Bourse index up.
newsitem.headline: Bank SBM stocks push Mauritius Bourse index up.

text.p: State Bank of Mauritius (SBM) stocks pushed up market index Semdex at the Stock Exchange of Mauritius on Wednesday, bourse officials said.
Semdex climbed by 6.61 points to 378.80. Traded volume was 26.92 million rupees from 1,131,191 shares compared to 20.15 million rupees on 485,820 shares on Monday.

SBM gained 10 cents to 13.00 rupees on 726,160 shares, Mauritius Commercial Bank (MCB) was stable at 85.50 rupees on 43,000 shares, whereas British American Insurance (BAI) lost 5 cents to 8.50 rupees on 14,340 shares.
"There was a big buying interest on SBM on Wednesday as it was not quoted last Monday due to a great demand for its shares and not a single offer," one broker said.
He said that the same thing happened to Shell which was not traded in five consecutive weeks prior to Wednesday, when it gained 1.20 rupees to 21.60 rupees on 26,630 shares.
Hotel-based Sun Resorts was 1.60 rupee higher to 46.70 rupees on 202,571 shares, New Mauritius Hotels (NMH) lost 70 cents to 35.30 rupees on 76,000 shares.
"Foreign investors have shown buying interest in Sun Resorts," another broker said.
Air Mauritius lost 30 cents to 39.70 on 150 shares.
